entry.title: Octopress Publisher
entry.content:
I need to deal with Drupal and WordPress during my daily work. When it comes to my personal blog, I want something lightweight, simple, and straightforward. After trying different blog platform, I decided to stay with Octopress.

While using Octopress several times, I realized I always had to fire up terminal and type the certain commands, e,g rake deploy and rake generate. Thus, I started to think how I could automate this receptive work. I tried several solutions, e.g keyboard mastero macro and BBEdit applescript. Finally, I found the simplest workflow for myself, Alred and Octopress publisher workflow.

It is easier to generate and publish post to Octopress through Octoppress publisher. All I need to do is type keyword blog and blog generate in my Alfred. It is done.

When I installed Octopress publisher in the beginning. The function of blog generate didn’t work. I looked into the script and added one line script. It works as I wish now.

Original script

```shell script

!/bin/bash

Path to your octopress installation

OCTOPATH=‘/Users/stephentseng/Dropbox/octopress’

if [[ -s “$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm” ]] ; then

  source "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm"

fi

cd $OCTOPATH >> /dev/null rvm use 1.9.3@octopress >> /dev/null rake generate >> /dev/null

if [[ $? -eq 0 ]] ; then

echo "Blog generated successfully!"

else

echo "Errors while generating static content. Check the console."

fi ```

Modified script

```

!/bin/bash

Path to your octopress installation

OCTOPATH=‘/Users/stephentseng/Dropbox/octopress’

if [[ -s “$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm” ]] ; then

  source "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm"

fi

cd $OCTOPATH >> /dev/null rvm use 1.9.3@octopress >> /dev/null rake generate >> /dev/null rake deploy >> /dev/null

if [[ $? -eq 0 ]] ; then

echo "Blog generated successfully!"

else

echo "Errors while generating static content. Check the console."

fi ```

entry.title: Octoeditor
entry.content:
I have been using Octopress for a while. Since I started to learn Vim, I had been thinking how to integrate Vim with Octopress. My idea is to creat, write, and upload a blog all in Vim. In this way, I don’t need to switch between termainal and Vim. After searching for a proper plug-in, I foud a plug-in called Octoeditor. With this plug-in, you can do it all in Vim with sevaral shortcuts. Here is my shortcuts:

Crate a blog map <Leader>on :OctopressNew<CR> List all blogd map <Leader>ol :OctopressList<CR> Rake Generate map <Leader>og :OctopressGenerate<CR> Rake Deploy map <Leader>od :OctopressDeploy<CR>
